what: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
title: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
text: Global spatial autocorrelation multivariate approach combining loci single analysis. autocorrelation coefficient  "r" calculated pair individuals specified distance  class. information see Smouse Peakall 1999, Peakall et al. 2003   Smouse et al. 2008.

title: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
code: gl.spatial.autoCorr(   x = NULL,   Dgeo = NULL,   Dgen = NULL,   coordinates = "latlon",   Dgen_method = "Euclidean",   Dgeo_trans = "Dgeo",   Dgen_trans = "Dgen",   bins = 5,   reps = 100,   plot.pops.together = FALSE,   permutation = TRUE,   bootstrap = TRUE,   plot_theme = NULL,   plot_colors_pop = NULL,   CI_color = "red",   plot.out = TRUE,   save2tmp = FALSE,   verbose = NULL )

title: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
text: x Genlight object [default NULL]. Dgeo Geographic distance matrix genlight object provided. typically Euclidean distance can meaningful  (geographical) distance metrics [default NULL]. Dgen Genetic distance matrix genlight object provided [default NULL]. coordinates Can either 'latlon', 'xy' two column data.frame column names 'lat','lon', 'x', 'y')  Coordinates provided via gl@$latlon ['latlon'] via gl@$xy ['xy']. latlon data projected meters using Mercator system [google maps] xy distance directly calculated coordinates [default . Dgen_method Method calculate genetic distances. See details [default "Euclidean"]. Dgeo_trans Transformation used geographic distances. See Dgen_trans [default "Dgeo"]. Dgen_trans can provide formula transform genetic distance. transformation can applied formula using Dgen  variable transformed. example: Dgen_trans = 'Dgen/(1-Dgen)'.   valid R expression can used    [default 'Dgen', identity function.] bins number bins distance classes (.e. length(bins) == 1) vectors break points. See  details [default 5]. reps number used permutation bootstrap analyses [default 100]. plot.pops.together Plot populations one plot. Confidence  intervals permutations shown [default FALSE]. permutation Whether permutation calculations null hypothesis  spatial structure carried [default TRUE]. bootstrap Whether bootstrap calculations compute 95% confidence intervals around r carried [default TRUE]. plot_theme Theme plot. See details [default NULL]. plot_colors_pop color palette populations list many colors populations dataset [default NULL]. CI_color Color shade 95% confidence intervals around  r estimates [default "red"]. plot.Specify plot produced [default TRUE]. save2tmp TRUE, saves ggplots listings session temporary directory (tempdir) [default FALSE]. verbose Verbosity: 0, silent fatal errors; 1, begin end; 2, progress log ; 3, progress results summary; 5, full report [default  NULL, unless specified using gl.set.verbosity].

title: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
text: Returns data frame following columns: Bin  distance classes N number pairwise comparisons within distance class r.uc uncorrected autocorrelation coefficient Correction correction r corrected autocorrelation coefficient L.r corrected autocorrelation coefficient lower limit (bootstap = TRUE) U.r corrected autocorrelation coefficient upper limit (bootstap = TRUE) L.r.null.uc uncorrected lower limit null hypothesis  spatial autocorrelation (permutation = TRUE) U.r.null.uc  uncorrected upper limit null hypothesis  spatial autocorrelation (permutation = TRUE) L.r.null corrected lower limit null hypothesis  spatial autocorrelation (permutation = TRUE) U.r.null corrected upper limit null hypothesis  spatial autocorrelation (permutation = TRUE) p.one.tail p value one tail statistical test

title: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
text: function executes modified version  spautocorr package PopGenReport. Differently  PopGenReport, function also computes 95% confidence  intervals around r via bootstraps, 95 null hypothesis spatial structure one-tail test via permutation,  correction factor described Peakall et al 2003. input can ) genlight object (latlon slot  populated), ii) pair Dgeo Dgen, either  matrix dist objects, iii) list   matrix dist objects   analysis needs carried multiple populations (case,   elements list class (.e.   matrix dist) population order two lists   . input genlight object, function calculates linear distance Dgeo relevant Dgen matrix (see Dgen_method)  population.  method selected genetic similarity matrix (e.g. "simple"  distance), matrix internally transformed 1 - Dgen  positive values autocorrelation coefficients indicates related  individuals similarly implemented GenAlEx. user provide  distance matrices, care must taken interpreting results similarity matrix generate negative values closely related  individuals. max(Dgeo)>1000 (e.g. geographic distances thousands  metres), values divided 1000 (example  become km) facilitate readability plots. bins length = 1 interpreted number (even) bins use. case starting point always minimum value  distance matrix, last maximum. numeric vector  length>1, interpreted breaking points. case,  first lowest value, last highest.  internal checks user responsibility ensure distance classes properly set . case, data fall outside range provided dropped. number bins  length(bins) - 1. permutation constructs 95% confidence intervals around null hypothesis spatial structure (two-tail test). data also used calculate probability one-tail test (See  references details). Bootstrap calculations skipped NA returned number  possible combinations given sample size given distance class < reps. Methods available calculate genetic distances SNP data: "propShared" using function gl.propShared. "grm" using function gl.grm. "Euclidean" using function gl.dist.ind. "Simple" using function gl.dist.ind. "Absolute" using function gl.dist.ind. "Manhattan" using function gl.dist.ind. Methods available calculate genetic distances SilicoDArT data: "Euclidean" using function gl.dist.ind. "Simple" using function gl.dist.ind. "Jaccard" using function gl.dist.ind. "Bray-Curtis" using function gl.dist.ind. Plots table saved temporal directory (tempdir) can  accessed function gl.print.reports listed  function gl.list.reports. Note can accessed  current R session tempdir cleared time   R session closed. Examples themes can used can consulted https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/ggtheme.html https://yutannihilation.github.io/allYourFigureAreBelongToUs/ggthemes/

title: Spatial autocorrelation following Smouse and Peakall 1999 ‚Äî gl.spatial.autoCorr
text: Smouse PE, Peakall R. 1999. Spatial autocorrelation analysis individual multiallele multilocus genetic structure. Heredity 82: 561-573. Double, MC, et al. 2005. Dispersal, philopatry infidelity:  dissecting local genetic structure superb fairy-wrens (Malurus cyaneus).  Evolution 59, 625-635. Peakall, R, et al. 2003. Spatial autocorrelation analysis offers new insights gene flow Australian bush rat, Rattus fuscipes. Evolution 57, 1182-1195. Smouse, PE, et al. 2008. heterogeneity test fine-scale genetic structure. Molecular Ecology 17, 3389-3400. Gonzales, E, et al. 2010. impact landscape disturbance  spatial genetic structure Guanacaste tree, Enterolobium cyclocarpum (Fabaceae). Journal Heredity 101, 133-143. Beck, N, et al. 2008. Social constraint absence sex-biased dispersal drive fine-scale genetic structure white-winged choughs. Molecular Ecology 17, 4346-4358.

text: x Name genlight object containing SNP data [required]. method One 1 | 2 | 3 | 4. Type method=0 list options  [method=1]. outfile Name output file (fasta format) ["output.fasta"]. outpath Path save output file (set tempdir default) probar TRUE, progress bar displayed long loops  [default = TRUE]. verbose Verbosity: 0, silent fatal errors; 1, begin end; 2, progress log; 3, progress results summary; 5, full report  [default 2 specified using gl.set.verbosity].

title: Concatenates DArT trimmed sequences and outputs a FASTA file ‚Äî gl2fasta
text: new gl object loci rendered homozygous.

title: Concatenates DArT trimmed sequences and outputs a FASTA file ‚Äî gl2fasta
text: Four methods employed: Method 1 -- heterozygous positions replaced standard ambiguity  codes. resultant sequence fragments concatenated across loci generate single combined sequence used subsequent ML phylogenetic analyses. Method 2 -- heterozygous state resolved randomly assigning one SNP variant individual. resultant sequence fragments concatenated across loci generate single composite haplotype used subsequent ML phylogenetic analyses. Method 3 -- heterozygous positions replaced standard ambiguity codes. resultant SNP bases concatenated across loci generate single combined sequence used subsequent MP phylogenetic analyses. Method 4 -- heterozygous state resolved randomly assigning one SNP variant individual. resultant SNP bases concatenated across loci generate single composite haplotype used subsequent MP phylogenetic analyses. Trimmed sequences SNP trimmed , rarely, adapter  mis-identity deleted. script writes composite haplotypes individual fastA file. Requires 'TrimmedSequence' among locus metrics (@$loc.metrics) information type alleles (slot loc.e.g. 'G/') position SNP slot position  ```genlight``` object (see testset.gl@position testset.gl@loc. format slots.)

title: Concatenates DArT trimmed sequences and outputs a FASTA file ‚Äî gl2fasta

title: Converts a genlight object into gds format ‚Äî gl2gds
text: function orders SNPS chromosome position converting SNPRelate format, required package. chromosome SNP can character numeric, described vignette SNPRelate: 'snp.chromosome, integer character mapping chromosome. Integer: numeric values 1-26, mapped order 1-22, 23=X, 24=XY (pseudoautosomal region), 25=Y, 26=M (mitochondrial probes), 0 probes unknown positions; allow NA. Character: ‚ÄúX‚Äù,  ‚ÄúXY‚Äù, ‚ÄúY‚Äù ‚ÄúM‚Äù can used , blank string indicating unknown  position.' using functions package SNPRelate datasets humans might necessary use option autosome.=FALSE avoid detecting chromosome coding. , important read documentation function using . chromosome information unmapped SNPS coded 0, required SNPRelate. Remember close GDS file working different GDS object function snpgdsClose (package SNPRelate).

ID_mom vector, many elements individuals, containing ID mother, '0' mother dataset [default '0']. sex_code vector, many elements individuals, containing sex code ('male', 'female', 'unknown'). Sex information needs  just start "F" "f" females, "M" "m" males  "U", "u" empty sex unknown [default 'unknown']. phen_value vector, many elements individuals, containing phenotype value. '1' = control, '2' = case, '0' = unknown [default '0']. verbose Verbosity: 0, silent fatal errors; 1, begin end; 2, progress log; 3, progress results summary; 5, full report [default 2 specified using gl.set.verbosity].

title: Converts a genlight object into PLINK format ‚Äî gl2plink
text: create PLINK files .bed, .bim .fam (bed_file = TRUE), necessary download binary file PLINK 1.9 provide path (plink_path). binary file can downloaded : https://www.cog-genomics.org/plink/ downloading, unzip file, access unzipped folder move  binary file ("plink") working directory. using Mac, might need open binary first grant  access binary. chromosome SNP can character numeric. chromosome information unmapped SNPS coded 0. Family ID taken  x$pop. Within-family ID ('0') taken indNames(x). Variant identifier taken locNames(x). SNP position taken accessor x$position. Chromosome name taken accessor x$chromosome Note names populations individuals contain spaces,  replaced underscore "_". like use chromosome information converting plink format  chromosome names human, need change chromosome   names 'contig1', 'contig2', etc. described section "Nonstandard   chromosome IDs" following link:   https://www.cog-genomics.org/plink/1.9/input

title: Converts a genlight object into a sfs input file ‚Äî gl2sfs
text: saves derived sfs, assuming reference allele ancestral, MAF sfs. stage function caters diploid organisms, samples one population , genotypes without missing data. Note sfs uses frequencies considered independent, data assumed independent (.e. linked) loci. means one site per tag considered 9i.e. secondaries removed). monomorphic site estimates provided (n.invariant.tags), sfs include number monomorphic sites data (biased estimates take account invariant tags included. affect parameter estimates analyses). Note number invariant tags can estimated gl.report.secondaries. limited number cases, ascertainment bias can explicitly modelled fastsimcoal2. See fastsimcoal2 manual details. expects dartR formatted genlight object, also  work genlight objects.

title: Converts DarT to genlight ‚Äî utils.dart2genlight
text: dart dart object created via read.dart [required]. ind.metafile Optional file csv format metadata individual (see details explanation) [default NULL]. covfilename Depreciated, use parameter ind.metafile. probar Show progress bar [default TRUE]. verbose Verbosity: 0, silent fatal errors; 1, begin end; 2, progress log; 3, progress results summary; 5, full report [default NULL].

title: Converts DarT to genlight ‚Äî utils.dart2genlight
text: genlight object. Including available slots filled. loc.names, ind.names, pop, lat, lon (provided via ind.metadata file)

title: Converts DarT to genlight ‚Äî utils.dart2genlight
text: ind.metadata file needs specific headings. First heading called id. ids match ids dart object colnames(dart[[4]]). following column headings optional. pop: specifies population membership individual. lat lon specify spatial coordinates (decimal degrees WGS1984 format). Additional columns individual metadata can imported (e.g. age, gender).

title:

genlight object using binary P/A data (SilicoDArT) ‚Äî utils.dist.binary
text: x Name genlight containing genotypes [required]. method Specify distance measure [default simple]. scale TRUE method='euclidean', distance scaled  fall range [0,1] [default FALSE]. swap TRUE working presence-absence data, presence  (disrupting mutation) scored 0 absence (presence disrupting  mutation) scored 1 [default FALSE]. output Specify format class object returned,  dist object class dist, matrix object class matrix [default "dist"]. verbose Verbosity: 0, silent fatal errors; 1, begin end; 2, progress log; 3, progress results summary; 5, full report [default 2].

title:
Calculates a distance matrix for individuals defined in a dartR
genlight object using binary P/A data (SilicoDArT) ‚Äî utils.dist.binary
text: object class 'dist' 'matrix' giving distances individuals

title:
Calculates a distance matrix for individuals defined in a dartR
genlight object using binary P/A data (SilicoDArT) ‚Äî utils.dist.binary
text: distance measure can one : Euclidean -- Euclidean Distance applied cartesian coordinates defined   loci, scored 0 1. Presence absence equally weighted. simple -- simple matching, 1 0 = 0; one 1  0 = 1. Presence absence equally weighted. Jaccard -- ignores matching 0, 1 = 0; one 1 0 = 1.  Absences different reasons. Bray-Curtis -- 0 = 0; 1 = 2; one 1 0 = 1. Absences  different reasons. Sometimes called Dice Sorensen  distance. One might choose disregard downweight absences comparison  presences homology absences less clear (mutation one  , restriction sites). call.

Calculates a distance matrix for individuals defined in a dartR
genlight object using binary P/A data (SilicoDArT) ‚Äî utils.dist.binary

text: Jackknife resampling statistical procedure dataset sample  size n, subsamples size n-1 used compute statistic. collection  values obtained can used evaluate variability around point  estimate. function can take loci, individuals populations  units conduct resampling. boldNote n small, jackknife resampling recommended. Parallel computation implemented. argument coden.cores indicates  number core use. "auto" [default], use one available  cores. number units small (e.g. populations),  real advantage using parallel computation. hand, number  units large (e.g. thousands loci), even parallel computation,  function can slow.

title:
OutFLANK:  An Fst outlier approach by Mike Whitlock and Katie Lotterhos,
University of British Columbia. ‚Äî utils.outflank
code: utils.outflank(   FstDataFrame,   LeftTrimFraction = 0.05,   RightTrimFraction = 0.05,   Hmin = 0.1,   NumberOfSamples,   qthreshold = 0.05 )

title:
OutFLANK:  An Fst outlier approach by Mike Whitlock and Katie Lotterhos,
University of British Columbia. ‚Äî utils.outflank
text: FstDataFrame data frame includes row locus, columns follows: $LocusName: character string uniquely names                   locus. $FST: Fst calculated locus. (Kept                     report unbased Fst results) $T1: numerator estimator Fst                    (necessary, $T2, calculate mean Fst) $T2: denominator estimator Fst $FSTNoCorr: Fst calculated locus without                    sample size correction. (Used find outliers) $T1NoCorr: numerator estimator Fst                    without sample size correction (necessary, $T2,                    calculate mean Fst) $T2NoCorr: denominator estimator Fst                    without sample size correction $: heterozygosity locus (used screen                    low heterozygosity loci different distribution) LeftTrimFraction proportion loci trimmed lower end range Fst likelihood funciton applied [default 0.05]. RightTrimFraction proportion loci trimmed upper end range Fst likelihood funciton applied [default 0.05]. Hmin minimum heterozygosity required including calculations locus [default 0.1]. NumberOfSamples number spatial locations included data set. qthreshold desired false discovery rate threshold calculating q-values [default 0.05].

title:
OutFLANK:  An Fst outlier approach by Mike Whitlock and Katie Lotterhos,
University of British Columbia. ‚Äî utils.outflank
text: function returns list seven elements: FSTbar: mean FST inferred loci marked outliers FSTNoCorrbar: mean FST (corrected sample size -gives upwardly biased estimate FST) dfInferred: inferred number degrees freedom chi-square distribution neutral FST numberLowFstOutliers: Number loci flagged significantly low FST (reliable) numberHighFstOutliers: Number loci identified significantly high FST results: data frame row locus. data frame includes original columns                    data set, six new ones: $indexOrder (original order input data set), $GoodH (Boolean variable TRUE expected               heterozygosity greater Hemin set input), $OutlierFlag (TRUE method identifies locus              outlier, FALSE otherwise), $q (q-value test neutrality locus) $pvalues (p-value test neutrality              locus) $pvaluesRightTail one-sided (right tail) p-value               locus

title:
OutFLANK:  An Fst outlier approach by Mike Whitlock and Katie Lotterhos,
University of British Columbia. ‚Äî utils.outflank
text: method looks Fst outliers list Fst's different loci. assumes locus genotyped populations approximately equal coverage. OutFLANK estimates distribution Fst based trimmed sample Fst's. assumes majority loci center distribution neutral infers shape distribution neutral Fst using trimmed set loci. Loci highest lowest Fst's trimmed data set inference, distribution Fst df/(mean Fst) assumed 'follow chi-square distribution. Based inferred distribution, locus given q-value based quantile inferred null'distribution. main procedure called OutFLANK -- see comments function immediately input output formats. functions necessary must uploaded, necessarily needed user directly. Steps:

title:
A utility script to reset to FALSE (or TRUE) the locus metric flags after
some individuals or populations have been deleted. ‚Äî utils.reset.flags
text: x Name genlight object containing SNP data tag presence/absence data (SilicoDArT) [required]. set Set flags TRUE FALSE [default FALSE]. value Set default verbosity functions, verbosity specified [default 2]. verbose Verbosity: 0, silent fatal errors; 1, begin end; 2, progress log; 3, progress results summary; 5, full report [default NULL].

title: Spatial autocorrelation coefficient calculations ‚Äî utils.spautocorr
text: Carries calculation spatial autocorrelation coefficient starting genetic geogaphic distance matrix.

title: Spatial autocorrelation coefficient calculations ‚Äî utils.spautocorr
code: utils.spautocor(   GD,   GGD,   permutation = FALSE,   bootstrap = FALSE,   bins = 10,   reps )

title: Spatial autocorrelation coefficient calculations ‚Äî utils.spautocorr
text: GD Genetic distance matrix. GGD Geographic distance matrix. permutation Whether permutation calculations null hypothesis  spatial structure carried [default TRUE]. bootstrap Whether bootstrap calculations compute 95% confidence intervals around r carried [default TRUE]. bins number bins distance classes (.e. length(bins) == 1) vectors break points. See  details [default 5]. reps number used permutation bootstrap analyses [default 100].

title: Spatial autocorrelation coefficient calculations ‚Äî utils.spautocorr
text: Returns data frame following columns: Bin  distance classes N number pairwise comparisons within distance class r.uc uncorrected autocorrelation coefficient bootstap permutation FALSE otherwise r estimates returned

title: Spatial autocorrelation coefficient calculations ‚Äî utils.spautocorr
text: code function based one spautocorr package PopGenReport, modified fix bugs (PopGenReport v 3.0.4 allow calculations bootstraps estimates. See details gl.spatial.autoCorr detailed explanation.

title: Spatial autocorrelation coefficient calculations ‚Äî utils.spautocorr
text: Smouse PE, Peakall R. 1999. Spatial autocorrelation analysis individual multiallele multilocus genetic structure. Heredity 82: 561-573. Double, MC, et al. 2005. Dispersal, philopatry infidelity: dissecting local genetic structure superb fairy-wrens (Malurus cyaneus). Evolution 59, 625-635. Peakall, R, et al. 2003. Spatial autocorrelation analysis offers new insights gene flow Australian bush rat, Rattus fuscipes. Evolution 57, 1182-1195. Smouse, PE, et al. 2008. heterogeneity test fine-scale genetic structure. Molecular Ecology 17, 3389-3400. Gonzales, E, et al. 2010. impact landscape disturbance spatial genetic structure Guanacaste tree, Enterolobium cyclocarpum(Fabaceae). Journal Heredity 101, 133-143. Beck, N, et al. 2008. Social constraint absence sex-biased dispersal drive fine-scale genetic structure white-winged choughs. Molecular Ecology 17, 4346-4358.
